elements.title: eensight
elements.description: The goal of the eensight tool is to contribute to the advancement of the automated measurement and verification (M&V) methods for energy efficiency. The eensight Python package accompanies the deliverable `D7.1 Methods for the dynamic measurement and verification of energy savings` of the H2020 project [SENSEI](https://senseih2020.eu/) Smart Energy Services to Improve the Energy Efficiency of the European Building Stock.

elements.title: Energy Star portfolio manager
elements.description: Portfolio Manager is an interactive resource management tool that enables you to benchmark the energy use of any type of building, all in a secure online environment.

elements.title: Allumia
elements.description: Energy efficiency as a service: streamlines project, process automation, recommendation system, access to financing, metering and benchmarking. Based in Seattle

elements.title: Audette
elements.description: A platform that creates a path forward to tackle the logistics, politics and financial barriers around decarbonization in the real estate industry, based in Vancouver

elements.title: Grid edge
elements.description: UK based Grid Edge transforms existing building into digital twin and data-driven insights help reduce energy demand with efficiency savings and improved operations and control. They want to change the way that people use energy by putting data-driven, intelligent control into the hands of commercial energy consumers. Has [raised 2.5M in Oct 19](https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/news-and-insights/press-releases/bp-expands-its-digital-energy-portfolio-by-investing-in-energy-management-platform-grid-edge.html) from BP Ventures

elements.title: Autodesk green building studio
elements.description: Green Building Studio is a flexible cloud-based service that allows you to run building performance simulations to optimize energy efficiency and to work toward carbon neutrality earlier in the design process.

elements.title: eemeter
elements.description: EEmeter — an open source toolkit for implementing and developing standard methods for calculating normalized metered energy consumption (NMEC) and avoided energy use. Developed by [Recurve](https://www.recurve.com/open-source), on [Github](https://github.com/openeemeter/eemeter)

elements.title: Qenergy
elements.description: Q Energy solution maximises the value of converting a building into a smart building solution, reducing energy costs by as much as 30 to 50 percent. Q Energy is currently positioned to focus on Behind-the-meter (BTM) solutions for commercial & industrial customers.

elements.title: R8 Technologies - Digital Operator
elements.description: Based in Estonia, R8 Digital Operator is solving mathematically the problem of regulating the BMS and HVAC controllable parameters by including building dynamical modelling, real-time user interaction and predictions of weather and electricity prices to heat, ventilate and cool at the right time and the right amount.

elements.title: RETScreen
elements.description: Implemented by the Canadian government, RETScreen® Clean Energy Management Software platform enables low-carbon planning, implementation, monitoring and reporting.

elements.title: Brainbox AI
elements.description: Located in Montreal, Canada our team is comprised of experts in the fields of AI, data science, real estate, HVAC and energy efficiency. We are driven by the fact that 20% of global greenhouse gas emissions originate from buildings and that HVAC systems are responsible for over 50% of those emissions.

elements.title: Twinview
elements.description: Twinview is a browser-based Digital Twin platform for the property sector connecting building systems’ data to a 3D model viewed on a single dashboard. Twinview is a part of [Space Group](https://spacegroup.co.uk/) - who specialise in the development of digital applications and services to improve the outcomes of the built environment. In [June 21](https://www.twinfm.com/article/great-portland-estates-integrates-digital-twin-technology-into-office-refurbishment) deployed to the Hickman building, whitechapel

elements.title: Passive Logic
elements.description: Sensors and actuators with a software platform that automates the whole building life cycle. [Keyframe capital](https://www.keyframecapital.com/) has invested in them

elements.title: Buildings IOT
elements.description: We develop and deploy cloud-based building analytics software, we implement complex Integrated Building Management Systems, we design and install controls systems, we maintain building assets and we provide IT managed services.

elements.title: Metrikus
elements.description: Metrikus is a platform that helps to make buildings more efficient. Implemented at Met Office HQ, [in the news](https://www.twinfm.com/article/monitoring-energy-usage-at-met-office-hq)

elements.title: Ecopilot
elements.description: Improve the working environment, improve productivity – Our clients/customers describe Ecopilot® and as an Artificial Intelligence that enables our various systems to collaborate, rather than constantly working against each other.

elements.title: Net2grid
elements.description: mobile app for energy consumption insights and efficiency. Finalists of free electrons 2020

elements.title: Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe - ROSE
elements.description: Nata nel 2014, nell’ambito dell’Associazione Genova Smart City, ROSE (Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe) è utilizzata nella Smart Polygeneration Microgrid del Campus di Savona dell’Università di Genova, scelto da Enel come Living Lab.

elements.title: Carbon Intelligence
elements.description: London based Carbon Intelligence brings together a team of strategists, technologists, data scientists and engineers. Our sustainability experts believe in business as the solution to a zero-carbon economy, not the problem.

elements.title: IES - Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)
elements.description: Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)  is a digital twin & simulation software to assess energy consumption and optimisation for aggregation of buildings in communities, developed by Integrated Environmental Solutions (IES)

elements.title: Redaptive
elements.description: Redaptive develops a strategic program and identify sites to maximize savings across portfolio. Received a $150M round in Oct 2020, src: [crunchbase news](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/redaptive-closes-on-150m-for-energy-efficiency-technologies/)

elements.title: The System Advisor Model (SAM)
elements.description: The System Advisor Model (SAM)  is a free techno-economic software model that facilitates decision-making for people in the renewable energy industry. Also has a web version with smaller feature set called [REopt](https://reopt.nrel.gov/faq.html). Check their [GH account](https://github.com/NREL) for what released open source

elements.title: ZERO Code Energy Calculator
elements.description: ZERO Code Energy Calculator relying on others' standards

elements.title: EC3
elements.description: EC3 is a free, industry-supported, construction-specific material search and planning tool that helps construction professionals quantify EC, find high-impact reductions, and guide procurement to reduce embodied carbon.

elements.title: Nuuka
elements.description: Nuuka is a Finnish software company that develops and provides Smart Building Management Software to commercial real estate owners.

elements.title: Quby formerly Toon
elements.description: Quby with their [Toon](https://www.toon.eu/) devices is Dutch platform offering smart thermostats for residential, acquired by [Eneco](https://www.enecogroup.com/) a big energy company providing infrastructure with renewable and batteries. (Toon uses databricks / airflow / spark / aws for computation, [here](https://databricks.com/session/using-apache-spark-in-the-cloud-a-devops-perspective))

elements.title: Systems Link
elements.description: Systems Link is owned by Inspired Energy (see below in the companies section) and is a full energy monitoring platform with support for tenants

elements.title: EnergyPlus
elements.description: EnergyPlus is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption—for heating, cooling, ventilation, lighting and plug and process loads—and water use in buildings. Funded by the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE) Building Technologies Office (BTO), and managed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)

elements.title: Fabriq
elements.description: Fabriq Building / Assets Energy monitoring platform

elements.title: Demand Logic
elements.description: Demand Logic is an energy control and optimisation platform for commercial buildings, similar to Fabriq.

elements.title: Sefaira
elements.description: Sefaira - early stage analysis for designers who care about building performance. Similar to IES, integrated in [Sketchup](https://www.sketchup.com/products/sefaira)

elements.title: Simptek
elements.description: Simptek Canadian company, provides insights into any building’s energy usage, identifying opportunities for cost savings

elements.title: EP&T
elements.description: EP&T deliver outcomes through operational efficiency in the built environment. We combine the Internet of Things, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Human Expertise to deliver cost reductions and improved comfort conditions.

elements.title: Synapsys
elements.description: Synapsys Founded in 2001 by experienced engineers, Synapsys Solutions develops and supplies innovative interfacing, integration and communication solutions for the intelligent building control industry.

elements.title: Modularity Grid
elements.description: Part of a consortium developing minigrids for low income communities in rural off-grid areas across Uganda. Working with Airbus to build a proof of concept with technologies applied to aerospace. In the news on [Wired](https://www.wired.co.uk/article/mini-power-grids)
